org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.harness

Class T_Fail

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.harness.T_Fail
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class T_Fail
extends java.lang.Exception
    Exception used to throw for errors in a unit test.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • exceptionFail

        public static T_Fail exceptionFail(java.lang.Throwable e)
        return a T_Fail exception to indicate the test failed due to an exception.

        Note: Since the Test Service catches all exceptions this seems to be of limited value.

        Returns:
        The exception.

      • testFail

        public static T_Fail testFail()
        return a T_Fail exception to indicate the test failed.
        Returns:
        the exception.

      • T_ASSERT

        public static final void T_ASSERT(boolean mustBeTrue)
                           throws T_Fail
        Check a test condition. If it is false, throw a T_Fail exception.
        Parameters:
        mustBeTrue - The condition.
        Throws:
        T_Fail - A test failure exception

      • T_ASSERT

        public static final void T_ASSERT(boolean mustBeTrue,
                                  java.lang.String msg)
                           throws T_Fail
        Check a test condition. If it is false, throw a T_Fail exception which includes a message.
        Parameters:
        mustBeTrue - The condition.
        msg - A message describing the failue.
        Throws:
        T_Fail - A test failure exception
